user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_destroy_post_processor:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_destroy_post_processor (struct MHD_PostProcessor *pp)
{
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  if (NULL == pp)
    return MHD_YES;
  if (PP_ProcessValue == pp->state)
  {
    /* key without terminated value left at the end of the
       buffer; fake receiving a termination character to
       ensure it is also processed */
    post_process_urlencoded (pp,
                             "\n",
                             1);
  }
  /* These internal strings need cleaning up since
     the post-processing may have been interrupted
     at any stage */
  if ( (pp->xbuf_pos > 0) ||
       ( (pp->state != PP_Done) &&
         (pp->state != PP_Init) ) )
    ret = MHD_NO;
  else
    ret = MHD_YES;
  pp->have = NE_none;
  free_unmarked (pp);
  if (NULL != pp->nested_boundary)
    free (pp->nested_boundary);
  free (pp);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I flagged the function declaration that uses the macro _MHD_EXTERN because such macros are commonly used to inject compiler-specific storage-class/visibility attributes (for example __attribute__((...)) or __declspec(...)), which are compiler extensions — the macro definition is not present in this fragment and therefore warrants investigation. No other code in the supplied function body contains obvious compiler-specific language extensions: there are no uses of __attribute__, __declspec, asm, typeof, statement-expressions, nested functions, C++-style attributes, or other nonstandard keywords or constructs. All other constructs (enum return type, pointer parameters, if statements, string literal, function calls, free()) are standard C and do not, in themselves, indicate use of a compiler language extension.
